comment: Monaghan Is an interesting individual because her hobbies include being difficult, being decidedly averse to using tech (to the detriment of her students), and taking herself too seriously. She's a professor, how could it be HER job to help her students? Why would she want them to succeed? That would be a crazy goal for an educator.

Very kind but also very strict and critical. Praise is given for great work and lack of work or low quality work is scoffed at. She cares greatly about her students and pushes students who she sees potential in very hard. Taking her in your first year prepares you for the rest of the program better than any other professor.

Dr. Monaghan is really sweet, but I definitely feel like she could be a better teacher. Lectures are really boring and the way she relays some of the information comes off as slightly culturally insensitive. However, she will work with you if you try hard enough, and she tries her best to help you succeed.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: She was alright when I took her, but she is strict on attendance which is there for all arch courses. As long as you show up on time, come for all the classes, and participate for disscussions you will be fine. She does give glares if you show up late. Didn't have a lot of homework which Im not complaining about since studio is time consuming.
Very condescending. Give little to no help and goes on hour long tangents often. Beware! Worst teacher Ive ever had at KSU.

In this class, be sure to show up on time and be an active participant if you want an A in her class. She expects quality work. I took her for the summer semester and she was pretty good overall. I learned a lot from her class. The two tests we had required you to pay attention and take notes. The research paper is not a joke either. Best of luck.

Prof Monaghan is really knowledgeable on the material. I enjoyed the class, it was interesting. Attendance mandatory. Reading assignments & reflections, like 1 or 2 tests, group research assignment and a final 2000 word paper (you'll present it too). Lecture heavy. It's really not difficult. Just pay attention, take notes, and go to class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Lecture heavy

comment: I personally did not like her as a professor because she was not understanding about my other schoolwork. Her first exam was very hard and nobody finished within the time limit they were given. The reports you do need to be very specific or you get a lot of points off. Other than that, she has weekly hw's you need to have turned in which are okay.

First, understand that this is a lecture class for your studio, but it focuses on your own personal values. What you need to focus on is the midterm and final. She is a very passive person and will not take excuses. Besides that, if you get her, just do the discussions for completion (no quizzes) and don't skip and you'll make it through.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: I absolutely loved her and the class. She will help you if you are willing to put in the work. If you don't do what is required to be done she will not waste her time telling you what to do. If you do the work you'll be fine but if not then be ready to get pointed out.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: Professor Monaghan is a wealth of knowledge in ancient architecture. She knows a lot, and class time sometimes is short for so much experience and Information. If you really want to learn and develop a crítical thinking in architecture, you will love her class. Quizzes and tests usually have bonus questions what helps a lot.

She is an awful professor. Exams are every other week & all the questions are long answer (lockdown browser w/ camera) She is condescending when you ask questions & expects you to read 6 books within the first month of class. She makes the class way harder than it needs to be. I will never be taking her for any other architecture class again!

We're all humans. She's not a terrible professor, you'll realize and thank her in the future. But do know what you're getting yourself in when you're thinking of majoring for architecture, it's not easy at all, stressful, sleepless nights but it'll be worth it at the end if you are passionate about it.
Professor Monaghan was really helpful, and helped me learn a lot throughout the semester. The pinups benefitted me a lot.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Participation matters

comment: Monaghan definitely doesn't deserve the bad rep she gets from other students. Her feedback during pinups was somewhat harsh, but at the end of the day, if you did good work, you were going to get a good grade. She is definitely a character though so be ready for all her quirks. Does tend to ramble on if she gets the chance, but other than shes good
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: Worst teacher I have ever experienced

Tips: don't be late, participate in discussions as much as possible, read everything assigned, don't miss class, and sign the roster. Do all of the assignments because there are not many. Everything from assignments to tests are short essay, so be sure to have read the readings. Have/Draw pictures in assignments/tests as explanations-she loves it.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Monaghan as a teacher, simply put, is terrible. Shes a nice enough person and you can have some good conversations with her, but that is where the good things stop. She constantly changes assignment specifics randomly and only tells half the class, she is sporadic in her grading and never gives you any idea on how you're doing, and gets mad easily.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: She  is the worst definitely do not recommend if you care for your grade  she is always changing assignments details so you will have to redo your work
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Monaghan is passionate when lecturing -- don't disrupt class or she will be mad and call you out. Be on time or early and be sure to sign the attendance sheet. Complete the readings and be ready to discuss in class and she will be so happy. Participate and complete the summaries (in detail!) and you should get an A.

I thoroughly enjoyed having professor Monaghan for my architecture orientation class. We were assigned readings and had to write summaries on these (as well as the lectures), but while in class, she just spoke about her own personal knowledge. We looked at her slide shows, discussed the readings (briefly), and learned a lot from her experience.
Professor Monaghan isn't bad for intro to studio, she is more artistic, and loves visuals, I recommend that if you like art you make like her as a teacher.  Overall, average as a teacher.

For sure the hardest professor. She definitely has her favorites and if you don't make it into that circle then life will suck for you. I found her to be really rude and inconsiderate. She's just a bad person

Gives a lot of homework for 1st year design communications class, she often teaches the lessons wrong, and has no knowledge for the subject. Often students will correct her. Grading is extremely biased. People will have the same exact drawings and she will give grades that are extremely different (95, 70). Lots of work, i dont recommend her.

I would not recommend her. She can be helpful, but only sometimes. She gives a very heavy workload, and her grading is very strict, even though she has no set grading system and grades everyone differently. She does not know enough about design communication to teach it. I suggest you take someone else.

I took her for Design Communication. At first, i could not manage to get an A on any assignments, right of the bat, her grading is very very strict, but as long as you put A LOT of time and effort in your work, show up to class, and are polite with her, she will like you and you can manage to get A's. But remember, she is a very difficult teacher.

She is very difficult and likes to give a lot of work. You will be tired and don't mention you ever getting sleep if you happen to come across some. Give her your best work and always defend your work. Don't stand up there and shy away, she will take note of that. Careful of what you say. She is strict, knows her stuff, and is demanding. I like her
Keys to success with Marietta: 1) listen 2) Attend class 3) Study 4) ask lots of questions---- you can easily get a good grade in her class with those rules.

Very tough grading. Does help out with your design but there was a few instances where she gave you advice and then when someone else critiqued her improvision she didnt stand behind it and basically threw the person up under the bus

I've heard horror stories about her studio class, but for this class, she is very qualified. Honestly, it's not the easiest class, but if you study, the tests are very easy(only 2).Plus,she makes you write a paper that she grades very easy as well.. Take her if you want to learn and also get an A or B without too much damage to your social life....
No Comments
